zh-cn: 朱利叶斯·罗伯特·奥本海默

birth_place.en: New York City, New York, United States

death_place.zh-cn: 美国新泽西州普林斯顿

description.zh-cn: 美国理论物理学家，被誉为“原子弹之父”。他在第二次世界大战期间领导洛斯阿拉莫斯实验室，参与研发了首批核武器。战后，他担任普林斯顿高等研究院院长，并就核政策向政府提供建议，但后来因其政治背景和对氢弹计划的立场而被撤销安全许可。
description.en: American theoretical physicist credited as the 'father of the atomic bomb' for his role in leading the Los Alamos Laboratory during World War II, which developed the first nuclear weapons. Post-war, he directed the Institute for Advanced Study and advised the government on nuclear policy, but later had his security clearance revoked due to his political background and stance on the hydrogen bomb program.

description.zh-cn: 罗伯特·奥本海默的妻子，曾是美国共产党党员。
description.en: Wife of J. Robert Oppenheimer and a former member of the Communist Party USA.

description.zh-cn: 美国物理学家，罗伯特·奥本海默的弟弟，曾是美国共产党党员。
description.en: American physicist, younger brother of J. Robert Oppenheimer, and a former member of the Communist Party USA.

description.zh-cn: 美国精神科医生和医师，美国共产党党员，曾是罗伯特·奥本海默的情人。
description.en: American psychiatrist and physician, a member of the Communist Party USA, and a former lover of J. Robert Oppenheimer.

description.zh-cn: 德国物理学家和数学家，量子力学的奠基人之一，罗伯特·奥本海默的博士导师。
description.en: German physicist and mathematician, one of the founders of quantum mechanics, and J. Robert Oppenheimer's doctoral advisor.

zh-cn: 加利福尼亚大学柏克莱分校

nodes.id: 洛斯阿拉莫斯国家实验室

zh-cn: 洛斯阿拉莫斯国家实验室

description.zh-cn: 第二次世界大战期间，由美国、英国和加拿大三国合作研发首批核武器的计划。
description.en: A research and development undertaking during World War II that produced the first nuclear weapons, led by the United States with the support of the United Kingdom and Canada.

description.zh-cn: 人类历史上首次核爆炸试验，由曼哈顿计划在美国新墨西哥州进行。
description.en: The first detonation of a nuclear weapon in human history, conducted by the Manhattan Project in New Mexico, United States.

description.zh-cn: 美国商人、慈善家和海军军官，曾任美国原子能委员会主席。他与奥本海默在氢弹研发等问题上存在严重分歧，是导致奥本海默安全许可被撤销的主要推手。
description.en: American businessman, philanthropist, and naval officer who served as Chairman of the U.S. Atomic Energy Commission. He had significant disagreements with Oppenheimer on issues like the hydrogen bomb development and was a primary instigator of the hearing that revoked Oppenheimer's security clearance.

description.zh-cn: 匈牙利裔美国理论物理学家，被誉为“氢弹之父”。他与奥本海默在氢弹研发问题上存在分歧，并在奥本海默的安全听证会上作出了不利证词。
description.en: Hungarian-American theoretical physicist, known as the 'father of the hydrogen bomb.' He disagreed with Oppenheimer on the development of the H-bomb and gave damaging testimony at Oppenheimer's security hearing.

description.zh-cn: 美国第35任总统。
description.en: The 35th President of the United States.

description.zh-cn: 美国第36任总统。
description.en: The 36th President of the United States.

description.zh-cn: 美国政治家，担任美国能源部长。
description.en: American politician serving as the United States Secretary of Energy.

nodes.id: 莱斯利·理查德·格罗夫斯

zh-cn: 莱斯利·理查德·格罗夫斯

description.zh-cn: 美国陆军工程师，在二战期间担任曼哈顿计划的总负责人。
description.en: A United States Army Corps of Engineers officer who oversaw the construction of the Pentagon and directed the Manhattan Project during World War II.

description.zh-cn: 美国第33任总统，批准对日本使用原子弹。
description.en: The 33rd President of the United States, who authorized the use of atomic bombs against Japan.

description.zh-cn: 美国物理学家，1944年诺贝尔物理学奖得主，奥本海默的朋友和同事。
description.en: American physicist and Nobel laureate in Physics in 1944, a friend and colleague of J. Robert Oppenheimer.

description.zh-cn: 美国作家、翻译家，奥本海默的朋友，其与奥本海默的互动成为安全听证会的焦点。
description.en: American author and translator, a friend of Oppenheimer whose interactions with him became a central focus of the security hearing.

description.zh-cn: 奥本海默与琼·塔特洛克自1936年开始交往，即使在与凯瑟琳结婚后，两人仍保持感情关系，直到塔特洛克于1944年自杀。
description.en: Oppenheimer and Jean Tatlock began a relationship in 1936 and maintained it even after his marriage to Katherine, until Tatlock's suicide in 1944.

description.zh-cn: 奥本海默在哥廷根大学师从马克斯·玻恩，并于1927年获得博士学位。
description.en: Oppenheimer studied under Max Born at the University of Göttingen, receiving his PhD in 1927.

relationships.target: 加利福尼亚大学柏克莱分校

position.zh-cn: 洛斯阿拉莫斯实验室主任

relationships.target: 洛斯阿拉莫斯国家实验室
莱斯利·理查德·格罗夫斯

description.zh-cn: 在曼哈顿计划期间，作为洛斯阿拉莫斯实验室主任的奥本海默向计划总负责人莱斯利·格罗夫斯将军汇报工作。
description.en: During the Manhattan Project, Oppenheimer, as the director of the Los Alamos Laboratory, reported to General Leslie Groves, the overall head of the project.

position.en: Chairman of the General Advisory Committee

description.zh-cn: 曼哈顿计划成功研发出世界上第一批核武器。
description.en: The Manhattan Project successfully developed the world's first nuclear weapons.

description.zh-cn: “三位一体”是人类首次核试验，验证了内爆式核武器设计的可行性。
description.en: Trinity was the first nuclear test, validating the feasibility of the implosion-type nuclear weapon design.

description.zh-cn: 在1949年苏联首次核试验后，奥本海默作为总顾问委员会主席，基于道德和技术原因反对美国加紧研发氢弹。直到1951年泰勒-乌拉姆设计出现后，他的立场才有所改变。
description.en: After the first Soviet nuclear test in 1949, Oppenheimer, as chairman of the General Advisory Committee, opposed the United States' crash program to develop the hydrogen bomb on moral and technical grounds. His position shifted only after the Teller-Ulam design emerged in 1951.

description.zh-cn: 1954年的安全听证会最终撤销了奥本海默的安全许可，使他无法再对美国官方政策产生直接影响。
description.en: The 1954 security hearing resulted in the revocation of Oppenheimer's security clearance, effectively ending his ability to directly influence official U.S. policy.

description.zh-cn: 刘易斯·斯特劳斯与奥本海默在氢弹研发等问题上存在严重分歧，并对奥本海默此前在国会面前对他的羞辱耿耿于怀，是推动撤销其安全许可的关键人物。
description.en: Lewis Strauss had significant disagreements with Oppenheimer on issues like the hydrogen bomb development, resented a past public humiliation by him before Congress, and was a key figure in pushing for the revocation of his security clearance.

description.zh-cn: 在奥本海默安全听证会上，爱德华·泰勒作出了对奥本海默不利的证词，表示如果国家安全事务由他人掌管会更感安全，此举严重损害了奥本海默的声誉，并激怒了科学界。
description.en: During the Oppenheimer security hearing, Edward Teller gave damaging testimony against Oppenheimer, stating he would feel more secure if national security affairs were in other hands. This act severely damaged Oppenheimer's reputation and angered the scientific community.

description.zh-cn: 在第二次红色恐慌的政治氛围下，奥本海默过往与美国共产党的关联成为其安全许可被撤销的关键因素。
description.en: In the political climate of the Second Red Scare, Oppenheimer's past associations with the Communist Party USA became a key factor in the revocation of his security clearance.

description.zh-cn: 奥本海默在与杜鲁门总统会面时表示感觉“双手沾了血”，此言激怒了杜鲁门，导致两人关系破裂。杜鲁门之后表示再也不想见到他。
description.en: Oppenheimer angered President Truman during a meeting by stating he felt he had 'blood on my hands,' leading to a rift between them. Truman later said he never wanted to see him again.

description.zh-cn: 1963年，奥本海默获颁恩里科·费米奖，此举被视为对他的一种政治平反。
description.en: In 1963, Oppenheimer was awarded the Enrico Fermi Award, an act widely seen as a gesture of political rehabilitation.

description.zh-cn: 美国总统约翰·肯尼迪决定授予罗伯特·奥本海默恩里科·费米奖，以示政治平反，但在颁奖前遇刺身亡。
description.en: U.S. President John F. Kennedy decided to award Robert Oppenheimer the Enrico Fermi Award as a gesture of political rehabilitation but was assassinated before he could present it.

description.zh-cn: 继任总统林登·詹森在肯尼迪遇刺后一周，向奥本海默颁发了恩里科·费米奖。
description.en: Following Kennedy's assassination, his successor Lyndon B. Johnson presented the Enrico Fermi Award to Oppenheimer a week later.

description.zh-cn: 2022年，时任美国能源部长珍妮弗·格兰霍姆宣布撤销1954年原子能委员会对奥本海默的决定，称其受到了不公平的对待。
description.en: In 2022, U.S. Secretary of Energy Jennifer Granholm vacated the 1954 Atomic Energy Commission decision against Oppenheimer, stating that he had been subjected to an unfair process.

description.zh-cn: 奥本海默与马克斯·玻恩共同发表了一篇关于分子数学描述的论文，后被称为玻恩-奥本海默近似，成为他被引用最多次的论文之一。
description.en: Oppenheimer co-authored a paper with Max Born on the mathematical description of molecules, which became known as the Born-Oppenheimer approximation and is one of his most cited works.

description.zh-cn: 马克斯·玻恩与奥本海默共同发表了一篇关于分子数学描述的论文，后被称为玻恩-奥本海默近似。
description.en: Max Born co-authored a paper with Oppenheimer on the mathematical description of molecules, which became known as the Born-Oppenheimer approximation.

description.zh-cn: 伊西多·拉比是奥本海默的密友和同事，曾在奥本海默的安全听证会上为其辩护。
description.en: Isidor Rabi was a close friend and colleague of Oppenheimer who defended him during his security hearing.

description.zh-cn: 哈康·舍瓦利耶是奥本海默在柏克莱的朋友。奥本海默在向安全部门汇报舍瓦利耶转达苏联索取情报的意图时，为了保护他而编造了故事，此事后来成为安全听证会的关键议题。
description.en: Haakon Chevalier was Oppenheimer's friend at Berkeley. To protect him, Oppenheimer fabricated a story when reporting Chevalier's relay of a Soviet approach for information, an incident that later became a key issue at the security hearing.

description.zh-cn: 奥本海默学习梵文并阅读了《薄伽梵谭》，他称其为塑造了他生命哲理的最重要典籍之一，并在“三位一体”核试验时引用了其中的诗句。
description.en: Oppenheimer learned Sanskrit and read the Bhagavad Gita, which he described as one of the most important texts that shaped his philosophy of life, famously quoting it at the Trinity nuclear test.

description.zh-cn: 奥本海默自称为共产主义的“同路人”，认同其诸多理想但未正式入党。他身边多人（包括妻子、弟弟、情人）是共产党员，他也曾参加被认为是共产党秘密分部的讨论组。
description.en: Oppenheimer described himself as a 'fellow traveler' of communism, agreeing with many of its goals without formally joining the party. Many people close to him (including his wife, brother, and mistress) were party members, and he attended a discussion group later identified as a secret communist unit.
